fields.description:
*Assessment*

When setting up a multi-cluster environment using Eucalyptus 3.4, where the following topology is deployed:

* 1 x CLC/Walrus
* 1 x CC/SC (Overlay)
* 1 x CC/SC (SAN - Equallogic)
* 1 x NC (one per cluster)

Registration of the secondary CC/SC is a pain.  Every time when the CC/SC was registered, one of the components showed as NOTREADY (it would flip flop between components depending upon which one was registered first).  Also, I would run into issue EUCA-7817 after I would de-register the cluster (CC/SC), and re-register the cluster with the same partition name used previously, to try and solve the issue of getting either one of the components out of the NOTREADY/DISABLED state. 

*Signs*

Signs would be that either one of the components would show up in a NOTREADY/DISABLED state.  Examples are below:

{code}
# euca-describe-services
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	StirItUp       	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Walrus 	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:StirItUp/
SERVICE	jetty          	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Jetty  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	cluster        	Exodus         	NaturalMystic  	NOTREADY  	69  	http://10.104.10.22:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Exodus:cluster:NaturalMystic/
SERVICE	cluster        	Legend         	IsThisLove     	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.1.185:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Legend:cluster:IsThisLove/
SERVICE	reporting      	bootstrap      	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	tokens         	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Tokens 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::tokens:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	euare          	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Euare  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::euare:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Dns    	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	storage        	Exodus         	TheHeathen     	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.22:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Exodus:storage:TheHeathen/
SERVICE	storage        	Legend         	NoWomanNoCry   	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.1.185:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Legend:storage:NoWomanNoCry/
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	loadbalancing  	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:eucalyptus:loadbalancing:loadbalancing:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	notifications  	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	autoscaling    	autoscaling    	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:eucalyptus:autoscaling:autoscaling:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	cloudwatch     	cloudwatch     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	69  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloudwatch:cloudwatch:10.104.10.6/
{code}

*Steps*

* Install Eucalyptus 3.4 on the following topology:
** 1 x CLC/Walrus
** 1 x CC/SC (cluster 1)
** 1 x CC/SC (cluster 2)
** 1 x NC (one per cluster)
** Managed mode (tunneling was disabled due to the fact that both CCs are on the same broadcast domain - 10.104.x.x)
* Start the CLC/Walrus, CC/SC (cluster 1 - configured with Overlay), and NC
* Register components (including ELB)
* Make sure instances can be launched/accessible (e.g. ssh, ping, etc.), volumes can be created/attached/detached/deleted
* Register second cluster (CC/SC - Equallogic) and NC.
* Observe status of services via euca-describe-services

*Pertinent Data*

* In the PRC, confirmed that the right VLANs were set for the following properties:
{code}
cloud.network.global_max_network_tag
cloud.network.global_min_network_tag
{code}
* Communication between each component was fine (i.e. multicast test worked fine)

*Workaround*

The current workaround is to stop call components (from the bottom - NC - up - CLC/Walrus), then restart components (from top - CLC/Walrus - down - NC).  When stopping and restarting components cluster 1 (non-SAN) was done first, then cluster 2 (Equallogic).

SERVICE	jetty          	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Jetty  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	loadbalancing  	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:eucalyptus:loadbalancing:loadbalancing:10.104.10.6/

SERVICE	storage        	Exodus         	TheHeathen     	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.22:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Exodus:storage:TheHeathen/
SERVICE	storage        	Legend         	NoWomanNoCry   	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.1.185:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Legend:storage:NoWomanNoCry/
SERVICE	tokens         	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Tokens 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::tokens:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	euare          	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Euare  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::euare:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	cluster        	Exodus         	NaturalMystic  	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.22:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Exodus:cluster:NaturalMystic/
SERVICE	cluster        	Legend         	IsThisLove     	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.1.185:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Legend:cluster:IsThisLove/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Dns    	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	reporting      	bootstrap      	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	StirItUp       	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Walrus 	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:StirItUp/
SERVICE	notifications  	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	cloudwatch     	cloudwatch     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloudwatch:cloudwatch:10.104.10.6/
{code}

comments.body: [~smarvin]. possible known issue to doc the workaround.
This issue may be addressed by changes in EUCA-7797

[~hspencer], can you provide more detail on exactly what you did and when? Specifically, did you use euca_conf --register* or euca-register* for the registration and de-registration?

Also, how long did you observe the component in the NOTREADY state after registration? Some of the timings for service state transitions have changed in 3.4.0 depending on the startup order of the system (specifically if you start components before the CLC is up they intentionally wait 5-10 minutes or so to finish bootstrapping).

Hey @Zach, 

Here is a list of the commands I ran when doing registration and de-registration.  Unfortunately, I didn't add the timestamp option to  my terminal history (I need to start doing that more often).  Hopefully this helps:

{code}
230  /usr/sinb/euca_conf --register-cluster --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 --component IronLionZion
  231  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-cluster --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 --component IronLionZion
....
  234  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-sc --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 --component IronLionZion
  237  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-sc --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 --component IronLionZion
  241  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-sc --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 --component IronLionZion
  244  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-sc --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 --component IronLionZion
 ....
  247  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --deregister-cluster --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22
  248  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --deregister-cluster --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 --component IronLionZion
  250  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-cluster --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 --component IronLionZion
  251  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-cluster --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 --component War
  ...
  261  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --deregister-sc --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 --component IronLionZion
  263  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --deregister-cluster --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 War
  264  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --deregister-cluster --partition NaturalMystic --host 10.104.10.22 --component War
  266  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-cluster --partition Exodus --host 10.104.10.22 --component NaturalMystic
 ...
  268  /usr/sbin/euca_conf --register-sc --partition Exodus --host 10.104.10.22 --component TheHeathen
{code}

Regarding euca-register*/euca-deregister* commands, are they not officially supported?

Regarding time I waited after registration, I typically wait about 5 to 10 minutes after doing component registration - especially with the SC when it involves using the SAN.  After I stopped and restarted all the components, it took about 6 minutes for everything go become enabled.  

Let me know if you need additional information.

I looked at the CLC, SC, and CC logs and this looks like a combination of user error (name conflicts on registration, trying to register both the SC and CC as component name 'IronLionZion' in partition 'NaturalMystic') and the CC not picking up a registration name change without a restart. The CLC logs indicate a registration error due to the name conflict in the DB. The SC just spins during that time waiting for the credential file (euca.p12).

The solution to this is for a de-register/reregister cycle the CC must be restarted to pick up it's new component id and that component IDs must be unique even if the component type is different--you can't have an SC and a CC with the same name.

Thanks [~hspencer], your input confirms what I was thinking. Did the system reject the SC registration? It should have returned an error to you saying that registration failed because the name was already in use. If it didn't then it is a bug.

I don't know if this is not a bug. Multi-cluster setup is still a pain and you have to get things exactly right. The system should be able to recover from user error of this nature, especially because the command-line tool itself has very little information on how exactly to get it right. Yes, it is documented, but you have to really pay attention and it is possible to get it wrong. 

But I don't think this is high priority, however something we need to fix eventually I think.
Closing Resolved issues for released versions of the software.
